doc.field: Includes drafts and printed copies of bills, requests from colleagues to cosponsor or support their bills, research materials (including newspaper articles, editorials, pamphlets, scholarly publications), and correspondence from constituents regarding legislation. Many of the bill files contain the committee report, the corresponding Senate bill, and/or the Public Law created from the bill. These files are arranged chronologically by Congress and numerically by bill number. Chronological indexes for bills and resolutions appear at the end of the bills (Box I:48). Legislation concerning relief and related actions of Congress affecting specific individuals and organizations appears at the end of the subseries in boxes I:49 and I:50 under "Private Legislation." These bills are arranged alphabetically by name.

Additional files contain memos, summaries of activities, or materials concerning future legislation. Within the 91st Congress is a file of "Future Bills," and preceding the 95th Congress are "Bill Sponsorship Memos" for that Congress, including memos from staff members to Brademas. The 95th Congress also includes a "Legislative Profile Report," summarizing each piece of legislation from January to May of 1977. Additionally, preceding the 96th Congress is a file entitled "Bills," containing memos and materials relating to legislation in the 96th Congress.
Series I : Legislative >> Subseries VI: Bills
